title: With Military Strike His Predecessors Avoided, Trump Takes a Huge Gamble
summary: President Trump is betting the United States can repel whatever retaliation Iran orders, and that it has destroyed the regime’s chances of reconstituting its nuclear program.

title: Senate Official Rejects Food Aid Cuts Proposed by Republicans in Megabill
summary: The ruling by the parliamentarian sent G.O.P. lawmakers back to the drawing board to cover the costs of President Trump’s domestic policy bill.

title: Trump Says He Wants to Fund More Trade Schools. Just Not These.
summary: The Job Corps program has long been the subject of debate, but it is now also a point of contention in the administration’s efforts to pull back the social safety net.

title: The Lessons of Trump’s Fight With Los Angeles Over Immigration
summary: The president’s clashes with Los Angeles over immigration were a decade in the making — and their outcome remains unclear.

title: Mahmoud Khalil Returns to New York After Months in Detention
summary: The Trump administration remains committed to deporting Mr. Khalil, a Columbia graduate and leading figure in the pro-Palestinian protest movement.

title: Midwest Cities Bake as Heat Wave Blankets the Central U.S.
summary: St. Louis, Chicago and Des Moines were among the cities that saw heat indexes hit triple digits on Saturday, with the East Coast bracing for similar conditions by Monday.

title: At Least 3 Dead in Tornadoes in North Dakota, Officials Say
summary: The deaths came after a series of large and long-lasting storms moved through North Dakota and Minnesota Friday night.

title: Windy Conditions Fan Forsyth Fire in Utah
summary: The Forsyth fire in Utah threatened a small community in the state’s southwest corner. Farther west, the Conner fire burned rapidly near Lake Tahoe.

title: Europe Is Finally Ready to Spend More on Defense. The Hard Part Is How.
summary: After a yearslong debate over NATO spending, European nations are poised to commit more funds to deter Russia. Now the region must decide how to unify its fragmented manufacturing.

title: Far-Right Party Tries to Expand Its Appeal in Germany’s West
summary: To reach voters outside its Eastern heartlands, the AfD is putting a new gloss on its anti-immigrant message — while sticking with its agenda.

title: In Final Push for Mayor, Lander Appears With 2 Cuomo Accusers
summary: The campaign event by Brad Lander, the New York City comptroller running for mayor, came as Andrew Cuomo, the front-runner, appeared with the mother of a murder victim.

title: Walmart Tries to Shed a Stodgy Vibe to Battle Digital-Native Rivals
summary: The retailing giant is spending billions to attract workers to a new headquarters and woo shoppers with drone delivery and a broader range of items (like Louis Vuitton handbags).

title: Study Suggests Weight-Loss Pill is as Effective as Ozempic
summary: The drugs in development include a pill that a new trial suggests is about as effective as Ozempic.

title: BTS Is Back Together. Does It Still Rule K-Pop?
summary: Suga is the last member of the wildly popular band to complete his national service. After more than two years apart, the challenge is to rekindle the magic.

title: How South Korea Became a Cultural Powerhouse
summary: With BTS poised to reunite, “Squid Game” returning and a Broadway show winning awards, the Korean cultural wave keeps on rolling.

title: Three Unknowns for America and the World After Trump’s Strike on Iran
summary: Despite Trump’s claim of success, he has created uncertainty and risk.

title: Political Violence Is Here, and It’s Working
summary: Trump is the Republican Party. That is settled. His violent talk is, then, the official political communication strategy of the ruling party.

title: Influencers Step Onto Center Stage at Cannes
summary: Big brands are increasingly courting social media stars, who descended on a major annual festival in France to pitch themselves to advertisers.

title: 4 Missing After Medical Helicopter Crashes in Quebec Lake
summary: The helicopter was carrying four crew members and a patient when it crashed on Friday night, officials said.

title: Nathan Silver, Who Chronicled a Vanished New York, Dies at 89
summary: An architect, he wrote in his book “Lost New York” about the many buildings that were destroyed before passage of the city’s landmarks preservation law.
